C001.name: Functions should not exceed 50 lines
C001.description: Improve readability and maintainability, reduce cognitive load, and enhance testability.

C002.name: Avoid code duplication > 10 lines
C002.description: Prevent messy code, make refactoring easier, and apply the DRY principle.

C003.name: Use clear variable names; avoid arbitrary abbreviations
C003.description: Improve readability, searchability, and enable self-documenting code.

C004.name: No TODOs older than 14 days
C004.description: Keep the codebase clean and updated, avoid accumulating technical debt.

C005.name: Each function should do only one thing
C005.description: Ensure single responsibility, better testability and readability.

C006.name: Function names must be verbs or verb-noun combinations
C006.description: Clearly express the purpose of the action and promote self-documenting code.

C007.name: Avoid comments that just restate the code
C007.description: Eliminate redundancy and encourage self-explanatory code.

C008.name: Declare variables close to where they are used
C008.description: Improve locality, avoid "dangling" variables, and reduce cognitive load.

C009.name: Each class should have a single responsibility
C009.description: Improve maintainability and scalability, avoid bloated classes.

C010.name: Avoid more than 3 levels of nested blocks
C010.description: Reduce code complexity by limiting nesting, improving readability and maintainability.

C011.name: Avoid catching generic exceptions (e.g., `catch (Exception)`)
C011.description: Prevent hiding real issues and ensure specific and recoverable error handling.

C012.name: Clearly separate Command and Query
C012.description: Ensure single responsibility and clear side-effects following the Command Query Separation (CQS) principle.

C013.name: Do not use dead code
C013.description: Keep the codebase clean; rely on Git history instead of commenting out code.

C014.name: Use Dependency Injection instead of directly instantiating dependencies
C014.description: Improve testability and decoupling by applying the Dependency Inversion Principle.

C015.name: Use domain language in class/function names
C015.description: Ensure correct domain understanding, reduce cognitive load, and improve communication with domain experts.

C016.name: TODOs must have a specific reason
C016.description: Avoid vague TODOs and ensure traceability and accountability.

C017.name: Do not put business logic inside constructors
C017.description: Ensure constructors only initialize objects, not perform business logic, to improve testability.

C018.name: Do not throw generic errors; always provide detailed messages
C018.description: Facilitate debugging, ensure traceability, and provide full context.

C019.name: Do not use `error` log level for non-critical issues
C019.description: Prevent noisy logs and false alarms; ensure consistent and meaningful log levels across the system.

C020.name: Do not import unused modules or libraries
C020.description: Reduce noise, improve build performance and code readability, and minimize bundle size.

C021.name: Consistently order import statements
C021.description: Improve consistency, readability, and manageability of imports; reduce merge conflicts.

C022.name: Do not leave unused variables
C022.description: Eliminate clutter, improve code clarity, and reduce memory footprint.

C023.name: Do not declare duplicate variable names in the same scope, including nested closures
C023.description: Avoid confusion and hard-to-trace bugs; prevent variable shadowing.

C024.name: Do not scatter hardcoded constants throughout the logic
C024.description: Improve reusability, readability, and ease of configuration changes.

C025.name: Each file should contain only one main class
C025.description: Reduce cognitive load when reading code; improve searchability and maintainability.

C026.name: Avoid functions with too many parameters (>6)
C026.description: Simplify functions, reduce confusion when calling, and minimize coupling.

C027.name: Each module should have a README.md if it is independent
C027.description: Improve onboarding, maintenance, and knowledge sharing.

C028.name: Use guard clauses instead of nested ifs
C028.description: Improve readability and avoid deep nesting, reducing cognitive complexity.

C029.name: All `catch` blocks must log the root cause of the error
C029.description: Improve traceability and incident resolution; avoid silent failures.

C030.name: Use custom error classes instead of generic system errors
C030.description: Improve error classification and handling; increase maintainability.

C032.name: Do not call external APIs in constructors or static blocks

C033.name: Separate processing logic and data access in the service layer

C034.name: Avoid directly accessing global state in domain logic

C035.name: Log all relevant context when handling errors

C036.name: Do not throw generic exceptions like `RuntimeException` or `Exception`

C037.name: API handler functions should return a standardized response object (not raw strings)

C038.name: Avoid logic that depends on file/module load order

C039.name: Do not store temporary data in global or static mutable fields
C039.description: Prevent issues related to shared state and race conditions in concurrent environments. Ensure thread-safety and testability. Using global or static mutable fields can introduce hard-to-detect and hard-to-fix bugs.

C040.name: Do not spread validation logic across multiple classes
C040.description: Centralize validation logic to simplify maintenance, increase reusability, and ensure consistency. Centralized validation helps reduce bugs and simplifies updating validation rules.

C041.name: Do not hardcode or push sensitive information (token, API key, secret, URL) into the repo
C041.description: Protect sensitive application data, avoid security risks, and comply with security standards. Exposing sensitive information can lead to serious security and privacy issues.

C042.name: Boolean variable names should start with `is`, `has`, or `should`
C042.description: Ensure clarity and readability by making boolean variables self-explanatory. This naming convention improves code maintainability and documentation.

C043.name: Do not use `print` or `console.log` in production code
C043.description: Ensure logging is done in a controlled and effective manner in production. Using `print` or `console.log` can lead to performance issues, security risks, and log management difficulties.

C044.name: Avoid reimplementing functions that already exist in standard libraries or helper utilities
C044.description: Leverage well-tested, optimized, and community-maintained libraries to reduce bugs and improve development efficiency.

C045.name: APIs should not return 500 errors for known business errors
C045.description: Ensure APIs return appropriate HTTP status codes so clients can handle errors effectively. HTTP 500 should be reserved for unexpected system errors.

C046.name: Avoid complex and lengthy regular expressions in core logic
C046.description: Keep code readable, maintainable, and efficient by avoiding the use of overly complex regular expressions in business-critical logic.

C047.name: Retry logic must not be duplicated in multiple places
C047.description: Centralize retry logic to improve consistency, maintainability, and observability of error handling and retry mechanisms.

C048.name: Do not bypass architectural layers (controller/service/repository)
C048.description: Maintain a clear layered architecture, ensuring logic and data flow are well-structured and maintainable.

C049.name: Always include a clear default case in switch/case statements
C049.description: Avoid missing logic for unexpected values, increasing stability and safety of the application.

C050.name: Do not call APIs in loops without batching or throttling
C050.description: Prevent system overload, resource contention, API rate limit violations, or the backend being perceived as under attack (DDoS).

C051.name: Do not use `sleep`, `wait`, or `delay` in business logic
C051.description: Avoid uncontrolled delays that cause asynchronous issues, make debugging and testing harder, and increase the risk of race conditions in production environments.

C052.name: Parsing or data transformation logic must be separated from controllers
C052.description: Enforce separation of concerns â€” controllers should only handle requests and delegate processing, improving testability, maintainability, and reuse.

C053.name: Avoid vague function names like "handle" or "process"
C053.description: Clarify function behavior, reduce hidden logic, and improve code readability and traceability.

C054.name: Do not process large datasets without pagination or lazy loading
C054.description: Prevent loading all data into memory, avoid out-of-memory errors, and improve performance and response time.

C055.name: Cache results of expensive functions if reused
C055.description: Reduce processing time and resource usage by caching results of resource-heavy operations.

C056.name: Do not process large datasets without logging or resource monitoring
C056.description: Track resource usage (CPU, RAM, I/O), detect anomalies early, and ensure system stability.

C057.name: Use optimal data structures instead of arrays for frequent lookups
C057.description: Reduce algorithm complexity, improve access speed, and optimize performance.

C058.name: Enums must have clear display labels
C058.description: Ensure enums shown in logs, UIs, or APIs are understandable and user-friendly.

C059.name: Do not create abstractions just to group constants
C059.description: Avoid unnecessary abstractions (class, enum) that add complexity without behavior or clear domain meaning.

C060.name: Do not override superclass methods and ignore critical logic
C060.description: Preserve important behavior or lifecycle logic defined in the superclass to ensure correctness and prevent silent errors.

C061.name: Write unit tests for business logic
C061.description: Ensure that core business flows are verifiable, help catch bugs early, avoid regressions, and increase system reliability.

C062.name: Interfaces or abstractions should not hold state
C062.description: Keep interfaces focused on defining behavior, making them easier to mock, implement, and test.

C063.name: Do not repeat the same test logic
C063.description: Avoid duplication in tests, making them easier to maintain, read, and extend when business logic changes.

C064.name: Interfaces should expose only necessary behavior
C064.description: Prevent leaking implementation details, improve encapsulation, and reduce coupling between modules.

C065.name: Each test case should verify only one behavior
C065.description: Make test failures easier to diagnose and ensure clarity and maintainability in test code.

C066.name: Test names should reflect what is being tested
C066.description: Help readers quickly understand the purpose of a test, making the test suite self-documenting and easier to trace on failure.

C067.name: Do not hardcode configuration inside code
C067.description: Improve configurability, reduce risk when changing environments, and make configuration management flexible and maintainable.

C068.name: Avoid unclear return types in functions
C068.description: Help callers know what data they receive, enable type checking, reduce hidden errors, and improve predictability.

C069.name: Components should communicate via abstractions
C069.description: Reduce module coupling, improve testability, ease mocking, and ensure replaceability without affecting callers.

C070.name: Tests should not rely on real time
C070.description: Improve test stability and speed; avoid flaky tests caused by system clock or real-world timing.

C071.name: Test class names should reflect the corresponding module
C071.description: Make it easy to identify the scope of testing, improve discoverability, and provide clear organization in the test structure.

C072.name: Each test should assert only one behavior
C072.description: Reduce ambiguity when a test fails, ensuring each test case validates a single, specific logic path.

C073.name: All required configurations must be validated at startup
C073.description: Prevent unclear runtime errors due to missing or incorrect config. Ensure the app fails fast if essential settings are absent.

C074.name: Avoid magic numbers/values in code
C074.description: Improve clarity and self-documentation in code, so readers can understand the meaning of values without additional context.

C075.name: All functions must explicitly declare return types
C075.description: Improve clarity, predictability, and enforce strict type control to avoid silent errors during refactoring or logic changes.

C076.name: All public functions must declare explicit types for arguments
C076.description: Ensure type safety for function inputs, reduce runtime errors, and enable static analysis during compilation or code review.

D001.name: Keep parameter names consistent when overriding methods

D003.name: Avoid calling methods/accessing properties on dynamic types
D003.description: Prevent runtime errors due to lack of type checking

D005.name: Always declare function return types
D005.description: Clarify logic and increase reliability in type checking

D006.name: Do not override `==` and `hashCode` in mutable classes
D006.description: Prevent logic errors when using mutable objects in collections.

D007.name: Do not pass default values when calling functions

D009.name: Do not use throw or control flow in `finally`

D010.name: Handle all cases when using `switch` with enums or enum-like classes

D011.name: Avoid importing `.dart` files from `lib/src` of other packages
D011.description: Avoid unstable dependencies that cause breaking changes.

D012.name: Avoid passing null to closure parameters

D013.name: Use adjacent strings or interpolation to create strings
D013.description: Easier to read and more efficient

D015.name: Use `final`, `const` for immutable variables
D015.description: Prevent bugs from unintended value changes

D016.name: Use explicit definitions for function types in parameters
D016.description: Increase clarity and accurate type checking

D017.name: Ensure simple and correct Regex syntax
D017.description: Prevent logic errors from invalid expressions

D018.name: Use `rethrow` instead of `throw` when re-throwing errors

D019.name: Use `isEmpty` / `isNotEmpty` for String, Iterable and Map

D020.name: Ensure valid URLs in `pubspec.yaml`
D020.description: Avoid metadata errors and poor security

D022.name: Place `child:` at the end when constructing widgets
D022.description: Help readability of widget tree and UI structure

D023.name: Prefer using `contains` for `List` and `String`
D023.description: Easier to read and more efficient

D024.name: Use `??` to convert `null` to `bool`
D024.description: Write concisely and avoid null exceptions

D025.name: Include `Key` in Widget constructors
D025.description: Help Flutter identify widgets, ensure efficient rebuilds and prevent errors when reordering widgets.

J001.name: Use Null Object or Optional instead of repetitive null checks
J001.description: Reduce the risk of NullPointerException (NPE) and avoid repeating `if (x != null)` throughout the code.

J002.name: Do not use `null` as a default value unless absolutely necessary
J002.description: Prevent NullPointerException by promoting clearer use of Optional or nullable types.

J003.name: Every enum must provide a clear toString or description when used in UI/logs
J003.description: Avoid unclear log messages such as `STATUS_1`, and improve readability.

J004.name: Avoid creating enums/classes just to wrap fixed constants
J004.description: Prevent unnecessary abstractions that clutter the codebase.

J005.name: Always use `final` or `const` for variables that do not change
J005.description: Clearly express intent and prevent unintended modifications.

J006.name: Do not override methods without calling `super` when required
J006.description: Preserve expected behavior and side effects in inherited logic.

K001.name: Use Named Arguments when functions have more than 3 parameters
K001.description: Improve readability, avoid errors from parameter order confusion, and make function calls clearer.

K002.name: Limit function complexity (Cyclomatic Complexity)
K002.description: Reduce logic complexity and branching to improve readability, testability, and maintainability.

K003.name: Avoid overly complex conditions
K003.description: Write clear, readable conditions that are easy to control and understand.

K004.name: Avoid nesting code more than 4 levels deep in functions
K004.description: Simplify logic to improve testability and maintainability.

K005.name: Do not use `GlobalScope`
K005.description: Avoid coroutines that exist beyond their intended lifecycle.

K006.name: Avoid using `suspend` when not necessary
K006.description: Avoid creating the misconception that a function contains asynchronous logic when it actually doesn't need it.

K007.name: Use `delay()` instead of `sleep()` in coroutines
K007.description: Optimize concurrency, avoid unnecessarily blocking threads.

K008.name: Do not swallow `CancellationException` in coroutines
K008.description: Ensure coroutine cancellation is properly propagated to avoid leaks or logic errors.

K009.name: Do not use `suspend` for functions returning `Flow`
K009.description: Avoid unnecessary asynchronous declarations, keep code clean.

K010.name: Do not check/cast exceptions in `catch` blocks
K010.description: Handle errors clearly, readably, and with the correct error type.

K011.name: Use `class` instead of `object` when extending `Throwable`
K011.description: Avoid using global singletons for exceptions, ensure exceptions carry separate information.

K012.name: Do not `return` or `throw` in `finally`
K012.description: Do not lose main logic when handling errors, avoid overriding original exceptions.

K013.name: Do not wrap and rethrow the same exception type
K013.description: Preserve the original error cause and stack trace.

K015.name: Use `for` instead of `forEach` on ranges
K015.description: Avoid creating unnecessary lambdas, improve runtime performance.

K016.name: Do not use `else` in `when` with `enum` or `sealed` classes
K016.description: Ensure all cases are handled explicitly and are easy to control.

K017.name: Do not directly call Garbage Collector (GC)
K017.description: Avoid poor performance or unpredictable behavior.

K018.name: Do not ignore function return values
K018.description: Avoid losing useful information, handle function results properly.

K019.name: Avoid using not-null assertion (!!) to get values from Map

K020.name: Do not call `toString()` on nullable objects

K021.name: Avoid unreachable catch blocks
K021.description: Remove redundant logic and unreachable code.

K023.name: Do not use properties before declaration
K023.description: Avoid logic errors from using uninitialized variables.

K024.name: Ensure proper modifier order
K024.description: Improve consistency and readability in the codebase.

K025.name: Ensure proper parameter order in Composable functions
K025.description: Ensure usability, memorability, and extensibility of Composable APIs.

K026.name: Each component should serve a single purpose
K026.description: Ensure components are easy to maintain, understand, and test.

K027.name: Composables returning Unit should use PascalCase and be nouns
K027.description: Follow naming conventions for Composables in Compose.

K028.name: `@Composable` factory functions that return values should use camelCase
K028.description: Follow standard Kotlin function naming conventions.

K029.name: Prefer Stateless `@Composable` functions
K029.description: Increase reusability, reduce complexity and side effects.

K030.name: Enhance extensibility by declaring state using interfaces
K030.description: Improve extensibility, reduce coupling with specific implementations.

K031.name: Create different components instead of multiple style classes

K032.name: Don't use `null` as default for nullable parameters

K034.name: Prefer `Slot` parameters for extensibility
K034.description: Allow users to customize content flexibly.

R001.name: Components must be idempotent
R001.description: Ensure that React components always return the same output for the same inputs (props, state, context).

R002.name: Side effects must run outside of render
R002.description: Prevent side effects from executing during render to avoid bugs and improve performance.

R003.name: Props and state are immutable
R003.description: Prevent direct mutation of props and state to avoid bugs and ensure proper behavior in React.

R004.name: Return values and arguments to Hooks are immutable
R004.description: Ensure that values passed into Hooks are not modified to prevent subtle bugs.

R005.name: Values are immutable after being passed to JSX
R005.description: Prevent mutation of values after they've been passed to JSX.

R006.name: Never call component functions directly
R006.description: Let React fully control when and how components are rendered.

R007.name: Never pass hooks as regular values
R007.description: Ensure that Hooks are used only as intended within React components.

R008.name: Only call Hooks at the top level
R008.description: Maintain the correct order of Hook calls so React can manage state properly.

R009.name: Only call Hooks from React functions
R009.description: Ensure Hooks are only called from valid React functions to prevent unexpected behavior.

S001.name: Fail securely when access control errors occur
S001.description: Ensure the system does not accidentally grant access when errors occur, helping to reduce the risk of unauthorized access and protect sensitive resources.

S002.name: Avoid IDOR vulnerabilities in CRUD operations
S002.description: Prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data by verifying users' actual access rights, avoiding reliance solely on IDs in URLs.

S003.name: URL redirects must be within an allow list
S003.description: Prevent Open Redirect vulnerabilities, protecting users from being redirected to malicious pages through spoofed input.

S004.name: Do not log login credentials, payment information, and unencrypted tokens
S004.description: Prevent leakage of sensitive information through log systems â€“ a common attack vector if logs are shared, stored incorrectly, or exploited.

S005.name: Do not use Origin header for authentication or access control
S005.description: Prevent authentication or authorization decisions based on `Origin` header â€“ which can be easily spoofed from the client side and is unreliable for security purposes.

S006.name: Do not send recovery or activation codes in plaintext
S006.description: Prevent leakage of verification codes, recovery codes, or activation tokens if email/SMS is intercepted or exposed â€“ thereby minimizing the risk of account takeover attacks.

S007.name: Do not store OTP codes in plaintext
S007.description: Protect the system from OTP reuse attacks if database/logs are accessed without authorization. OTP, magic-links, or reset codes must be treated like passwords â€“ only stored in one-way hashed form, not recoverable.

S008.name: Encryption algorithms and parameters must support flexible configuration and upgrades (crypto agility)
S008.description: Avoid binding the system to outdated cryptographic algorithms or parameters (like MD5, SHA-1, DES...), ensuring easy upgrades when standards change or new vulnerabilities emerge.

S009.name: Do not use insecure encryption modes, padding, or cryptographic algorithms
S009.description: Prevent security vulnerabilities from using outdated encryption or hash algorithms, insecure padding/encryption modes leading to data exposure, pattern leakage, or padding oracle attacks.

S010.name: Must use cryptographically secure random number generators (CSPRNG) for security purposes
S010.description: Prevent attackers from guessing security random values like OTP, session ID, recovery tokens... by ensuring they are generated from Cryptographically Secure PRNG provided by cryptographic libraries/modules.

S011.name: GUIDs used for security purposes must be generated according to UUID v4 standard with CSPRNG
S011.description: Prevent guessing, recreation, or exploitation of GUIDs when used as identifiers for sensitive resources, by ensuring GUIDs are generated according to UUID v4 standard with cryptographically secure random number generators (CSPRNG).

S012.name: Protect secrets and encrypt sensitive data
S012.description: Protect encryption keys, passwords, access tokens, API keys... from exposure through source code, `.env` files, or logs. Ensure sensitive data is always encrypted and keys are managed securely through Key Vault or HSM.

S013.name: Always use TLS for all connections
S013.description: Protect data in transit from leakage and Man-In-The-Middle (MITM) attacks by requiring all connections to use TLS (HTTPS), not allowing fallback to unencrypted protocols like HTTP.

S014.name: Only use TLS 1.2 or 1.3
S014.description: Protect network communication from attacks exploiting older TLS versions like BEAST, POODLE, Heartbleed, or downgrade attacks by only allowing TLS 1.2 or 1.3.

S015.name: Only accept trusted TLS certificates and eliminate weak ciphers
S015.description: Protect client-server connections from MITM attacks by only trusting valid TLS certificates signed by trusted CAs, and rejecting all unknown certificates or weak ciphers.

S016.name: Do not pass sensitive data via query string
S016.description: Prevent leakage of sensitive data through URLs by not passing sensitive information via query string, instead using HTTP body or headers in authenticated requests or private operations.

S017.name: Always use parameterized queries
S017.description: Prevent various forms of injection (SQL Injection, HQL Injection, NoSQL Injection) by always using parameterized queries or ORM when accessing data.

S018.name: Prefer Allow List for Input Validation
S018.description: Ensure all user inputs or external data sources are strictly validated by accepting only known good values. This reduces the risk of attacks like XSS, SQL Injection, and other security issues caused by malformed or unexpected input.

S019.name: Sanitize input before sending emails to prevent SMTP Injection
S019.description: Prevent SMTP/IMAP injection by removing control characters and ensuring proper formatting of user input used in email sending.

S020.name: Avoid using `eval()` or executing dynamic code
S020.description: Prevent Remote Code Execution (RCE) by disallowing use of dynamic code execution functions like `eval()`, `Function()`, `exec()`, `Runtime.exec()` with user-controlled input.

S021.name: Sanitize user-generated Markdown, CSS, and XSL content
S021.description: Prevent script injection via user-generated content in Markdown, CSS, or XSL.

S022.name: Escape data properly based on output context
S022.description: Prevent XSS, Header Injection, Email Injection by escaping output data according to context (HTML, JS, URL, Header, Email, etc).

S023.name: Prevent JSON Injection and JSON eval attacks
S023.description: Prevent JavaScript execution via unsafe JSON handling or injection attacks.

S024.name: Protect against XPath Injection and XML External Entity (XXE)
S024.description: Prevent XPath injection and XXE vulnerabilities that can expose files, trigger SSRF, or run malicious code.

S025.name: Always validate client-side data on the server
S025.description: Ensure all data from clients is validated server-side to prevent attacks from forged or malicious input.

S026.name: Apply JSON Schema Validation to input data
S026.description: Ensure all incoming JSON is fully validated by schema (structure, types, constraints) before processing.

S027.name: Never expose secrets in source code or Git
S027.description: Prevent leakage of credentials, API keys, tokens, or sensitive config via source code or version control.

S028.name: Limit upload file size and number of files per user
S028.description: Prevent resource abuse and protect against DoS attacks by limiting file size, number of files, and user storage usage.

S029.name: Apply CSRF protection for authentication-related features
S029.description: Prevent Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks where an attacker triggers unauthorized actions using the victim's authenticated session.

S030.name: Disable directory browsing and protect sensitive metadata files
S030.description: Prevent unauthorized access to file listings or metadata files such as `.git`, `.env`, `.DS_Store`, which can reveal sensitive system or source code information.

S031.name: Set the Secure flag on session cookies for HTTPS protection
S031.description: Prevent attackers from stealing session cookies via unencrypted HTTP, especially on public or monitored networks (MITM).

S032.name: Enable HttpOnly attribute for Session Cookies to prevent JavaScript access
S032.description: Prevent JavaScript (including malicious code during XSS attacks) from accessing session cookies, thereby limiting the risk of theft and session hijacking.

S033.name: Set SameSite attribute for Session Cookies to reduce CSRF risk
S033.description: Limit the browser's ability to automatically send cookies in cross-origin requests, thereby minimizing the risk of Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks.

S034.name: Use `__Host-` prefix for Session Cookies to prevent subdomain sharing
S034.description: Prevent cookie theft between subdomains (e.g., `api.example.com` accessing cookies from `admin.example.com`) by using cookies prefixed with `__Host-`, which enforce strict security tied to the root domain.

S035.name: Set the `Path` attribute for Session Cookies to limit access scope
S035.description: Reduce the risk of session cookie leaks or abuse across multiple apps under the same domain (e.g., `/app1` and `/app2`) by limiting cookie scope via the `Path` attribute.

S036.name: Prevent LFI and RFI using path validation and allow-lists
S036.description: Block Local File Inclusion (LFI) and Remote File Inclusion (RFI) attacks where attackers access sensitive files (e.g., `/etc/passwd`, `C:\Windows\system32`) or execute code from external URLs.

S037.name: Set anti-cache headers to prevent sensitive data leakage
S037.description: Prevent browsers from caching sensitive data such as tokens, personal information, or financial content which could leak when users share devices or use back/forward navigation.

S038.name: Hide system version information in HTTP Headers
S038.description: Prevent attackers from discovering backend technologies (e.g., server, framework, OS) via HTTP response headers that can be used to target known vulnerabilities.

S039.name: Never transmit Session Tokens via URL parameters
S039.description: Prevent session hijacking by ensuring session tokens are not stored in browser history, server logs, proxy logs, or leaked via Referrer headers.

S040.name: Regenerate Session Token after login to prevent Session Fixation
S040.description: Prevent attackers from setting a session ID before login and taking over the session post-login if the ID remains unchanged.

S041.name: Session Tokens must be invalidated after logout or expiration
S041.description: Prevent users from reusing old session tokens after logout or timeout, which could lead to session hijacking.

S042.name: Require re-authentication for long-lived sessions or sensitive actions
S042.description: Reduce the risk of session hijacking or privilege misuse by forcing re-authentication after long idle periods or before critical actions.

S043.name: Password changes must invalidate all other login sessions
S043.description: Ensure attackers cannot continue using old session tokens after a password change. Enforce correct access control after sensitive updates.

S044.name: Require re-authentication before modifying critical information
S044.description: Prevent unauthorized changes to critical information when the session is not fully authenticated. Protect users in half-open session states.

S045.name: Implement brute-force protection for login
S045.description: Prevent brute-force and credential stuffing attacks by limiting failed login attempts and introducing friction for suspicious behavior.

S046.name: Notify users of critical account changes
S046.description: Alert users to sensitive actions to detect potential compromise and allow timely intervention.

S047.name: Secure temporary passwords and activation codes
S047.description: Ensure that temporary passwords and activation codes are secure, unpredictable, single-use, and time-limited.

S048.name: Do not expose current password during reset flow
S048.description: Ensure the current user password is never revealed or sent in any step of the password reset process.

S049.name: Authentication codes must expire quickly
S049.description: Ensure that OTPs, reset tokens, and activation links expire quickly to reduce risk of interception or reuse.

S050.name: Session tokens must have minimum 64-bit entropy and use secure algorithms
S050.description: Prevent attackers from predicting or forging session tokens by ensuring sufficient length, entropy, and cryptographic safety.

S051.name: Support 12â€“64 character passwords; reject >128 characters
S051.description: Allow users to use strong passphrases while preventing resource abuse from excessively long inputs.

S052.name: OTPs must have at least 20-bit entropy
S052.description: Ensure OTPs are strong enough to resist brute-force or statistical guessing attacks.

S053.name: Only use secure OTP algorithms like HOTP/TOTP
S053.description: Ensure OTPs are secure against spoofing and replay attacks by using safe, standard algorithms.

S054.name: Avoid using default accounts like "admin", "root", "sa"
S054.description: Prevent brute-force attacks and ensure traceability and accountability in auditing. Avoid predictable, shared accounts lacking identity association.

S055.name: Validate input Content-Type in REST services
S055.description: Prevent attacks via malformed or improperly handled data by validating incoming data format (e.g., JSON, XML).

S056.name: Protect against Log Injection attacks
S056.description: Prevent attackers from injecting fake log entries that distort tracking or exploit log analysis systems.

S057.name: Use synchronized time and UTC in logs
S057.description: Ensure consistent, accurate log timestamps to support auditing, investigation, and cross-system comparison.

S058.name: Protect applications from SSRF attacks
S058.description: Prevent Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) and protect internal networks or cloud metadata services from unauthorized access via untrusted input.

S059.name: Configure Allow List for server-side outbound requests
S059.description: Reduce risks from the server making outbound requests to untrusted systems (SSRF, malicious downloads, data leaks).

SW001.name: Use Swift's observe property instead of legacy KVO

SW002.name: Delegate Protocols must be class-only
SW002.description: Allow the use of `weak` to avoid retain cycles (memory leaks).

SW003.name: Do not directly instantiate system protocols

SW005.name: Use `enum` for types with only static members

SW006.name: Always dispose NotificationCenter observers
SW006.description: Prevent memory leaks due to retain cycles.

SW007.name: Avoid direct instantiation of system types
SW007.description: Prevent creating types that may cause errors or are unnecessary.

SW008.name: Do not use optionals for Boolean values
SW008.description: Avoid ambiguous logic and hard-to-control conditions.

SW009.name: Prefer `.isEmpty` over `.count == 0`
SW009.description: Make code clearer and more efficient.

SW010.name: Prefer `isEmpty` over comparing to `""`
SW010.description: Increase clarity and avoid potential errors with empty strings.

SW012.name: Always provide a clear message when using `fatalError`
SW012.description: Make it easier to trace application crashes.

SW013.name: Prefer `for-where` over `if` inside loops
SW013.description: Make code clearer and express intent.

SW014.name: Avoid `as!` (force cast)
SW014.description: Prevent crashes due to incorrect type casting.

SW017.name: Limit function parameters to less than 6

SW018.name: Do not use tuples with too many elements
SW018.description: Reduce complexity, improve readability and maintainability.

SW019.name: Use Swift initializers instead of Objective-C style
SW019.description: Keep Swift code pure, clear, and maintainable.

SW020.name: Data types should be nested at most 1 level
SW020.description: Avoid unreadable and hard-to-debug code due to deep nesting.

SW021.name: Do not use access modifiers with extensions

SW022.name: Call `super` in lifecycle methods
SW022.description: Ensure default behaviors are executed correctly.

SW023.name: Do not use `override` in extensions
SW023.description: Avoid changing original behavior and keep extensions for extension only.

SW025.name: Do not declare Unit Test functions as `private`
SW025.description: Ensure tests are executed from the test target.

SW026.name: Do not call `super` in specific methods

SW028.name: Prefer shorthand syntax `[T]` over `Array<T>`
SW028.description: Make code more idiomatic and concise.

SW029.name: Warn for unused closure parameters
SW029.description: Avoid compile warnings and improve readability.

SW030.name: Avoid using `enumerated()` when index is not needed
SW030.description: Remove redundant code and avoid performance risks.

SW031.name: Do not use optional binding just to call a function or property
SW031.description: Increase clarity and avoid deep nesting.

SW032.name: Do not use `@IBInspectable` with unsupported types and constants

SW033.name: Parameters must be vertically aligned when calling functions
SW033.description: Improve readability and maintain consistent code style.

SW034.name: Use `-> Void` instead of `-> ()` for function types

SW035.name: Delegates must be marked as `weak`
SW035.description: Prevent retain cycles and memory leaks.

T002.name: Interface names should start with 'I'

T003.name: Avoid using @ts-ignore without a clear justification
T003.description: Avoid using @ts-ignore without a clear reason.

T004.name: Disallow declaring empty types like `type X = {}`
T004.description: Avoid declaring meaningless empty data types.

T007.name: Avoid declaring functions inside constructors or class bodies
T007.description: Avoid declaring functions inside constructors or class bodies.

T010.name: Avoid deeply nested union or tuple types
T010.description: Avoid complex nested union or tuple types.

T015.name: Do not use `instanceof` to distinguish behavior when interfaces are available

T016.name: Use strict type checking
T016.description: Leverage TypeScript's type safety to reduce runtime errors.

T017.name: Use async/await instead of Promises
T017.description: Improve code readability and ease debugging of async operations.

T018.name: Use proper error handling
T018.description: Ensure robust error handling and good user experience.

T019.name: Do not assign to this arbitrarily
T019.description: Maintain proper context and avoid this manipulation.

T020.name: Avoid export default for multi-responsibility modules

T021.name: Limit deeply nested generics
